title.en: An Aspiration to Accomplish Perfection, Maturation and Purification

text.en: To each and every buddha of the three times,
The Mother of the victorious ones, Transcendent Perfection of Wisdom,
And āryas in all your compassion—
Grant us your blessings!
text.en-trans: dak gyü jingyi lab tu sol

text.en: Fooling myself, thinking “I have obtained a human body endowed with the freedoms and advantages”,
Through wrong views, I spend my life in unfree states.
My nonsensical words disregard cause and effect;
Straying into heinous deeds, I lose my personal advantages;
Not cared for by holy beings, I lack the circumstantial advantages;
text.en-trans: dampé ma zin zhen jor pang

text.en: I confuse mere protection from fear and good aspirations as true Dharma;
text.en-trans: jik kyob lek mön chö su trul

text.en: I carelessly squander offerings, engage in wrong livelihood,
And fail to recognize the Dharma when it appears.
text.en-trans: chö kyi zuk la chö min sem

text.en: At the moment of my death, I will have nowhere to go
text.en-trans: shi ma tak tu ngensong lé

text.en: But the lower realms—
I pray from the bottom of my heart: may my mind turn towards the Dharma!
text.en-trans: nying né chö la gyurwar shok

text.en: May I be taken care of by holy beings,
Generate renunciation, heartfelt sadness and devotion,
And may compassion and the sacred mind set upon awakening
Arise spontaneously, without any effort!
text.en-trans: gyü la ngam ngam shuk kyi kyé

text.en: With the wish to benefit all sentient beings,
text.en-trans: semchen kün la pen sem dang

text.en: And my conduct being that of the six transcendent perfections,
Obstacles and demons do not arise.
Practising intensely for as long as I live,
May I traverse the paths of accumulation and joining,
Which can take one incalculable aeon, much more swiftly through skill in means.
Through the truth of the path of seeing,
Arrived at through the practice of the vajra path,
The seven impure bhūmis are perfected during the second incalculable aeon,
text.en-trans: dün gyi drangmé nyi dzok shing

text.en: And the three pure bhūmis during the final incalculable aeon.
text.en-trans: dak sa sum gyi drangmé ta

text.en: Having actualized the supreme empowerment’s space of innate wisdom,
May I refrain from aiming for nirvāṇa’s ultimate truth
And instead strive to perfect my aspirations for others’ benefit.
text.en-trans: ngön du mi jé mönlam dzok

text.en: May I mature all sentient beings
And purify everyone and everything in this world
text.en-trans: nö dang chü kyi düpa yi

text.en: As the pure realms of the buddhas—
May I bring the acts of perfecting, maturing and purifying to completion!
text.en-trans: dzok min jang sum tarchin shok
